plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small bulbous perennial that bursts into bloom early in the year, often emerging through late winter snow in temperate regions. Its cup-shaped flowers herald the coming of spring.
plants.funFact: Crocuses were one of the first bulbs cultivated by humans, admired by Romans and Greeks for their vivid colors.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub prized for its large, showy blooms that appear in the cooler months when few other plants flower. Its glossy dark leaves highlight its bright flowers.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Camellias were named after the Jesuit botanist Georg Kamel, despite being unknown in his homeland.

plants.name: Erica carnea
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub that produces bell-shaped flowers throughout the winter and early spring. It is commonly found in mountainous and colder regions.
plants.funFact: Winter Heath is often used as groundcover in gardens to provide color during the cold months when few other flowers bloom.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A coastal tree known for its unique cylindrical flower spikes appearing in the Australian summer and sometimes extending into winter months. These flowers attract a variety of nectar-feeding birds and mammals.
plants.funFact: The Banksia genus is named after Sir Joseph Banks, the botanist who collected specimens during Captain Cook's first voyage.
